data.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound derived from Ti(iOPr)4 and hydroquinone?
What type of crystal system does the compound 2 belong to?
What is the crystal size of the material derived from Et2O and labeled as 2?
What solvent was used to convert compound 1 to red crystals of 3a?
What is the dimensionality of the metal−organic network formed by compound 3a?
What is the empirical formula of the compound with a pleated sheet structure labeled as 3a?
What is the crystal system of the compound labeled as 3a?
Is the compound labeled as 2 three-dimensional?
Does the compound labeled as 3b have a pleated sheet structure?
Is the empirical formula of the compound derived from Ti(iOPr)4 and hydroquinone C18H14O6Ti?
Does the compound labeled as 3a revert to 3b under various conditions?
Is the crystal system of the compound labeled as 3a monoclinic?
Is the compound labeled as 2 derived from THF?
What is the crystal size of the material derived from pyridine and labeled as 3a?
What is the yield of green/black crystals labeled as 3b when synthesized?
What is the role of hydroquinone in the conversion of compound 1 to burgundy, microcrystalline compounds?
data.answer: It deaggregates 1, leading to mono- or dititanium fragments that can be reconstituted into microcrystalline networks.

data.question: What is the effect of solvent on the dimensionality and connectivity of the metal−organic network in compounds 2 and 3a?
data.answer: Solvent-dependent changes in the dimensionality and connectivity are observed.

data.question: Is the compound labeled as 2 synthesized using a modified procedure of Burch?
Does the compound labeled as 3a have a body-centered arrangement of bioctahedral dititanium building blocks?
What is the role of pyridine in the synthesis of compound 3a?
data.answer: Pyridine is used as a solvent to convert compound 1 to red crystals of 3a.
